main event: A driver in Topeka, Kansas spotted a rotating, oval-shaped, brilliant white object in the sky on February 16, 1967 at 2150 hours.
interesting points: The object was rotating and disappeared behind a hill.
The observer compared the object's profile to a jet aircraft in a holding pattern at a distance of 15-20 miles.
The object's attitude corresponded to a heading of 330 degrees at an altitude of 28,000 feet, matching a Utility Flight Military flight that occurred in the area.
The 'eruptions' described were likely reflections off of light falling snow in the area.
The observer was in a moving vehicle, and the relative positions of the car and aircraft could have caused the object to appear stationary.
sighted object: A rotating, oval-shaped, brilliant white object
